channel.title: free range statistics
channel.description: I write about applications of data and analytical techniques like statistical modelling and simulation to real-world situations. I show how to access and use data, and provide examples of analytical products and the code that produced them.

item.title: Covid-19 vaccination rates in the Pacific
item.description: I compare vaccination rates in the Pacific to GDP per capita and find the evidence isn't strong enough to say that there is a relationship between the two.

item.title: Showing women proportion of Parliamentarians on a map
item.description: I have a go at showing the proportion of members of Parliament that are women on a map of the world, as an experiment in a tricky data visualisation

item.title: Transformations for compositional data
item.description: I look into the use of Isometric Centralised Box-Cox Transformed Ratio for analysing compositional data like proportions of soil, time use or chemicals.

item.title: Pacific island choropleth map
item.description: Drawing an annotated choropleth map of Pacific Island countries and territories.

item.title: Pacific island population pyramids
item.description: I show how to access data from the Pacific Data Hub to draw population pyramids of Pacific Island countries and territories.

item.title: Smoothing charts of Supreme Court Justice nomination results
item.description: Sometimes a Twitter storm of chart-shaming is unfair, mean, and frankly misguided. I reproduce and defend a chart originally produced by FiveThirtyEight to illustrate changes over time in how nominations for US Supreme Court Justices have been voted on in the Senate.

item.title: Principal components and penguins
item.description: Beware that the direction of a principal component can vary depending on the sequence of the original data.

item.title: Making a database of security prices and volumes
item.description: I make a SQLite database of daily observations of Australian security prices, volumes and short positions.

item.title: Visualising stock prices and volume
item.description: After some experimenting with how to show stock price and volume at the same time, I conclude unsuprisingly that the charts commonly used in finance are pretty much fit for purpose, but alternative presentations have their place too.

item.title: Shiny in production for commercial clients
item.description: Shiny can be an effective platform to quickly build data-intensive web applications that otherwise would not be commercially viable. The rationale for using Shiny at the right time is convenience, cost, and statistical and graphics power.
